name: Natyamayuri - 18th Annual Day Celebration
description: Natya Mayuri Classical Dance Institute presents its 18th Annual Day Celebration, marking nearly two decades of dedicated training in the classical art of Bharatanatyam. Founded and led by Vidushi Sree Lakshmi Ranganath, the institute showcases the journey of its students through traditional and thematic presentations that weave together nritta, nritya, and natya. The evening is a celebration of discipline, devotion, and artistic growth, reflecting the institute’s commitment to preserving classical traditions while nurturing the next generation of dancers.  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Natya Mayuri Classical Dance Institute Founded and Directed by Vidushi Sree Lakshmi Ranganath Location: No. 15, Sundara Mudaliar Street, Ulsoor, Bangalore – 560008 (Behind Someshwara Temple) About the Institute: Established over 18 years ago in the cultural heart of Ulsoor, Natya Mayuri Classical Dance Institute is a premier center for learning the sacred art of Bharatanatyam. The institute is committed to preserving the classical tradition while nurtur- ing young talent with discipline, devotion, and creativity. Under the guidance of Vidushi Sree Lakshmi Ranganath—a Doordarshan-graded Bharatanatyam artist, senior disci- ple of the legendary late Guru Smt. Padmini Ramachandran, and a seasoned performer—the institute has trained over 400 students since inception, with many of them now performing at prestigious venues across India. Vision & Approach: · To uphold and pass on the rich tradition of Bharatanatyam in its purest form. · To blend Nritta (pure dance), Nritya (expressive dance), and Natya (dramatic storytelling) through thematic and traditional repertoires. · To develop each student into a confident performer through rigorous training, theory sessions, individual mentoring, and exposure to stage performances. Key Highlights: · Arangetram and Advanced Level Training · Participation in Natyanjali festivals, temple performances, and sabha events · Opportunities to perform in thematic productions and cultural programs · Focus on Sanskrit shlokas, bhakti compositions, and Purandara Dasa, Annamacharya, and Tamil padams · Integration of Indian cultural values and spiritual essence in the dance journey Notable Performances: · Arunachaleshwara Temple, Thiruvannamalai, · Sri Kapaleeshwarar Temple, Mylapore · Natyanjali Festival – Chidambaram, Kumbakonam, Kutralam, Tenkasi, Coimbatore · Regular events at Bangalore’s heritage temples and cultural sabhas Director’s Profile – Vidushi Sree Lakshmi Ranganath: · Doordarshan-graded Bharatanatyam artist · Over 30 years of experience as a performer and teacher · Senior disciple and teaching assistant to Smt. Padmini Ramachandran · Awarded the title "Narthana Mani" · Deeply committed to grooming the next generation of Bharatanatyam dancers with authenticity and grace Contact: No. 15, Sundara Mudaliar Street, Ulsoor, Bangalore – 560008 Phone +91 98450 70651, email— sree.r.lakshmi@gmail.com/  natyamayuri.sreelakshmi@gmail.com Instagram / Facebook: “natyamayuri_classical_dance_”
